item.text: When the people complained, it displeased the Lord. When the Lord heard it, his anger burned, and so the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed some of the outer parts of the camp.
When the people cried to Moses, he prayed to the Lord, and the fire died out.
So he called the name of that place Taberah because there the fire of the Lord burned among them.
Now the mixed multitude who were among them craved more desirable foods, and so the Israelites wept again and said, “If only we had meat to eat!

We <st data-num="02142" class="">remember</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01710" class="">fish</st> we used to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="02600" class="">freely</st><n id="3" /> in <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, the <st data-num="07180" class="">cucumbers</st>, the <st data-num="020" class="">melons</st>, the <st data-num="02682" class="">leeks</st>, the <st data-num="01211" class="">onions</st>, and the <st data-num="07762" class="">garlic</st>.

But <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">we</st><n id="1" /> are <st data-num="03002" class="">dried up</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="0369" class="">there is nothing</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">at all</st> <st data-num="05869" class="">before us</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="01115 0413">except</st> this <st data-num="04478" class="">manna</st>!”

(Now the <st data-num="04478" class="">manna</st> was like <st data-num="01407" class="">coriander</st> <st data-num="02233" class="">seed</st>, and its <st data-num="05869" class="">color</st> like the <st data-num="05869" class="">color</st> of <st data-num="0916" class="">bdellium</st>.

And the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="07751" class="">went about</st> and <st data-num="03950" class="">gathered</st> it, and <st data-num="02912" class="">ground</st> it with <st data-num="07347" class="">mills</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="01743" class="">pounded</st> it in <st data-num="04085" class="">mortars</st>; they <st data-num="01310" class="">baked</st> it in <st data-num="06517" class="">pans</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="05692" class="">cakes</st> of it. It <st data-num="01961 02940">tasted</st> <st data-num="02940">like</st> <st data-num="03955" class="">fresh</st> <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>.<n id="1" />
And when the dew came down on the camp in the night, the manna fell with it.)
Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, everyone at the door of his tent; and when the anger of the Lord was kindled greatly, Moses was also displeased.
And Moses said to the Lord, “Why have you afflicted your servant? Why have I not found favor in your sight, that you lay the burden of this entire people on me?

Did <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="02029" class="">conceive</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0518" class="">Did</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">give birth</st> to<n id="2" /> them, <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> you should <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, ‘<st data-num="05375" class="">Carry</st> them in your <st data-num="02436" class="">arms</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> a <st data-num="0539" class="">foster father</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="05375" class="">bears</st> a <st data-num="03243" class="">nursing child</st>,’ <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0127" class="">land</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> you <st data-num="07650" class="">swore</st> to their <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st>?

From <st data-num="0370" class="">where</st> shall I get<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> to <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> to <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they <st data-num="01058" class="">cry</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> me, ‘<st data-num="05414" class="">Give</st> us <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st>, that we may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st>!’<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="05375" class="">bear</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">alone</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> it<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03515" class="">is</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">too</st> <st data-num="03515" class="">heavy</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">for</st> me!
But if you are going to deal with me like this, then kill me immediately. If I have found favor in your sight then do not let me see my trouble.”

The Lord said to Moses, “Gather to me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know are elders of the people and officials over them, and bring them to the tent of meeting; let them take their position there with you.

Then I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take part of the Spirit that is on you, and will put it on them, and they will bear some of the burden of the people with you, so that you do not bear it all by yourself.

“And say to the people, ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, and you will eat meat, for you have wept in the hearing of the Lord, saying, “Who will give us meat to eat, for life was good for us in Egypt?” Therefore the Lord will give you meat, and you will eat.

You will <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> just <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">two days</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>,
but a whole month, until it comes out your nostrils and makes you sick, because you have despised the Lord who is among you and have wept before him, saying, “Why did we ever come out of Egypt?”’”
Moses said, “The people around me are 600,000 on foot; but you say, ‘I will give them meat, that they may eat for a whole month.’

Would they <st data-num="04672" class="">have enough</st> if the <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st> and <st data-num="01241" class="">herds</st> were <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> for them? <st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01709" class="">fish</st> of the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> were <st data-num="0622" class="">caught</st> for them, would they <st data-num="04672" class="">have enough</st>?”
And the Lord said to Moses, “Is the Lord’s hand shortened? Now you will see whether my word to you will come true or not!”
So Moses went out and told the people the words of the Lord. He then gathered seventy men of the elders of the people and had them stand around the tabernacle.

And the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to them, and he took some of the Spirit that was on Moses and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but did not do so again.

But two men remained in the camp; one’s name was Eldad, and the other’s name was Medad. And the Spirit rested on them. (Now they were among those in the registration, but had not gone to the tabernacle.) So they prophesied in the camp.

And a<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st> <st data-num="07323" class="">ran</st> and <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, “<st data-num="0419" class="">Eldad</st> and <st data-num="04312" class="">Medad</st> are <st data-num="05012" class="">prophesying</st> in the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>!”

<st data-num="03091" class="">Joshua</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05126" class="">Nun</st>, the <st data-num="08334" class="">servant</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, one of his <st data-num="0979" class="">choice young men</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06030 0559">said</st>,<n id="3" /> “My <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, <st data-num="03607" class="">stop</st> them!”<n id="4" />
Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for me? I wish that all the Lord’s people were prophets, that the Lord would put his Spirit on them!”
Then Moses returned to the camp along with the elders of Israel.

Now a wind went out from the Lord and brought quail from the sea, and let them fall near the camp, about a day’s journey on this side, and about a day’s journey on the other side, all around the camp, and about three feet high on the surface of the ground.

And the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">stayed up</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> that <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04283" class="">next</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, and <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered</st> the <st data-num="07958" class="">quail</st>. The one who <st data-num="04591" class="">gathered the least</st> <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st> <st data-num="02563" class="">homers</st>,<n id="2" /> and they <st data-num="07849" class="">spread</st> them <st data-num="07849" class="">out</st><n id="3" /> for themselves <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>.
But while the meat was still between their teeth, before they chewed it, the anger of the Lord burned against the people, and the Lord struck the people with a very great plague.
So the name of that place was called Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people that craved different food.
The people traveled from Kibroth Hattaavah to Hazeroth, and they stayed at Hazeroth.
